derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin avulsio(n-), from the verb avellere, from ab- 'from' + vallere 'pluck'

means.word_mean: 1. an abrupt change in the course of a stream that forms the boundary between two parcels of land resulting in the loss of part of the land of one landowner and a consequent increase in the land of another
2. a forcible tearing or surgical separation of one body part from another
